categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the Eliza Repository

content.text: Several bug fixes and improvements have been made to the Eliza repository recently. A fix for BM25 was implemented along with dependency updates (PR #4411). There were also multiple reverts of previous changes, including rolling back plugin loading code (PR #4477), reverting ESM type declarations in Core (PR #4475), and reverting ESM type generation in SQL, Bootstrap & OpenAI packages (PR #4473).

Code improvements included cleaner load-plugin code (PR #4478) and utilizing existing utilities for monorepo resolution (PR #4468). Documentation was enhanced with the addition of docstrings to `monorepo-resolve` (PR #4469). A maintenance update was also made to ensure Bun is installed in the update-docs process (PR #4474).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository recently:

1. PR #4471 by samarth30 introduces a new feature related to a PM (Project Management) agent, titled "Feat/jimmy pm agent".

2. PR #4481 by ai16z-demirix focuses on test setup and coverage for OpenAI plugins, labeled as "chore: plugin open ai test setup and coverage".

3. Multiple PRs by wtfsayo address various issues and improvements:
   - PR #4476 fixes a worker.js client build issue
   - PR #4472 attempts to fix bootstrap export issues
   - PR #4478 improves code cleanliness for plugin loading, labeled as "chore: cleaner load-plugin code"

These pull requests represent ongoing development efforts in the elizaOS/eliza project, including feature additions, bug fixes, and code quality improvements.

Between May 7-8, 2025, the elizaos/eliza repository saw significant development activity with 16 new pull requests, of which 8 were merged. The project maintained an active community with 23 contributors working during this period. No new issues were reported during this timeframe.

The provided source only mentions 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' without providing any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary of the top contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project.
